Understate: The claim may understate Steve Adler's involvement in city government by stating that he has "never been active in anything that has to do with City Hall."
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or specific examples to support the assertion that Steve Adler has never been active in city government.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being active in city government is the only measure of experience or qualification for a mayoral candidate.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations for Steve Adler's involvement in city government, such as his representation of clients in legal matters involving the city and his volunteer work in causes connected to city government.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Steve Adler has served as the board chair of the Austin-area Anti-Defamation League, which was involved in city-led initiatives such as the Hate Crimes Task Force.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the lack of involvement by Steve Adler in city government by stating that he has never taken an active role or appeared before the council on any item.
